semantic_title: External Cause Code Cannot Be Principal Diagnosis
section_path: Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > a. General External Cause Coding Guidelines > 6) External cause code can never be a principal diagnosis

content.full_text: An external cause code can never be a principal (first-listed) diagnosis. (Evidence: pg no: 88, L41-L42)
content.summary: External cause codes are always secondary and cannot be used as principal or first-listed diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 88, L41-L42)

detailed_rules.rule_text: External cause codes can never be principal or first-listed diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 88, L41-L42)
detailed_rules.explanation: This is a fundamental rule that external cause codes are always supplementary information and cannot serve as the primary reason for the encounter (Evidence: pg no: 88, L41-L42)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify the primary health condition or injury

Step 3: Assign external cause codes as secondary codes
Step 4: Verify external cause codes are not in primary position
